019package org.jgrapes.core.internal;
020
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Optional;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.concurrent.Future;
027import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
028import java.util.function.Consumer;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Associator;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
031import org.jgrapes.core.CompletionEvent;
032import org.jgrapes.core.CompletionLock;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Eligible;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
035import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
036
037/**
038 * Provides the implementations of methods to class {@link Event} that
039 * need access to classes or methods that are visible in the implementation
040 * package only. The class is not intended to be used as base class
041 * for any other class.
042 * 
043 * @param <T> the result type of the event. Use {@link Void} if handling
044 * the event does not produce a result
045 */
046public abstract class EventBase<T>
047        implements Eligible, Future<T>, Associator {
048
049    /** The event that caused this event. */
050    private EventBase<?> generatedBy;
051    /** Number of events that have to be processed until completion.
052     * This is one for the event itself and one more for each event
053     * that has this event as its cause. */
054    private final AtomicInteger openCount = new AtomicInteger(1);
055    /** Completion locks. */
056    private Set<CompletionLockBase> completionLocks;
057    /** Set when the event is enqueued, reset when it has been completed. */
058    private EventProcessor processedBy;
059    /** The events to be fired upon completion. Using this attribute
060     * provides a slightly faster access than invoking
061     * {@link Event#completionEvents()}, which wraps the result in
062     * an unmodifiable set. */
063    protected Set<Event<?>> completionEvents;
064    /** Set when the event has been completed. */
065    protected boolean completed;
066    private boolean requiresResult;
067    /** Event is tracked by {@link VerboseHandlerReference}. */
068    private boolean tracked = true;
069
070    /**
071     * See {@link Event#channels()}.
072     *
073     * @return the channel[]
074     */
075    public abstract Channel[] channels();
076
077    /**
078     * See {@link Event#handled()}.
079     */
080    protected abstract void handled();
081
082    /**
083     * See {@link Event#isStopped()}.
084     */
085    public abstract boolean isStopped();
086
087    /**
088     * See {@link Event#currentResults()}.
089     */
090    protected abstract List<T> currentResults();
091
092    /**
093     * See {@link Event#setRequiresResult(boolean)}.
094     */
095    protected EventBase<T> setRequiresResult(boolean value) {
096        if (requiresResult == value) {
097            return this;
098        }
099        if (value) {
100            openCount.incrementAndGet();
101            requiresResult = true;
102        } else {
103            requiresResult = false;
104            decrementOpen();
105        }
106        return this;
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * See {@link Event#firstResultAssigned()}.
111     */
112    protected void firstResultAssigned() {
113        if (requiresResult) {
114            decrementOpen();
115        }
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Returns <code>true</code> if the event has been enqueued in a pipeline.
120     * 
121     * @return the result
122     */
123    protected boolean enqueued() {
124        return processedBy != null || completed || isCancelled();
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Invoked when an exception occurs while invoking a handler for an event.
129     * 
130     * @param eventProcessor the manager that has invoked the handler
131     * @param throwable the exception that has been thrown by the handler
132     */
133    protected abstract void handlingError(
134            EventPipeline eventProcessor, Throwable throwable);
135
136    /**
137     * If an event is fired while processing another event, note
138     * the event being processed. This allows us to track the cause
139     * of events to the "initial" (externally) generated event that
140     * triggered everything.
141     * 
142     * @param causingEvent the causing event to set
143     */
144    /* default */ void generatedBy(EventBase<?> causingEvent) {
145        generatedBy = causingEvent;
146        if (causingEvent != null) {
147            causingEvent.openCount.incrementAndGet();
148        }
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Set the processor that will (eventually) process the event. 
153     * 
154     * @param processor the processor
155     */
156    /* default */ void processedBy(EventProcessor processor) {
157        this.processedBy = processor;
158    }
159
160    public Optional<EventPipeline> processedBy() {
161        return Optional.ofNullable(processedBy).map(
162            procBy -> procBy.asEventPipeline());
163    }
164
165    /**
166     * @param pipeline
167     */
168    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CognitiveComplexity")
169    /* default */ void decrementOpen() {
170        if (openCount.decrementAndGet() == 0 && !completed) {
171            synchronized (this) {
172                completed = true;
173                notifyAll();
174            }
175            if (completionEvents != null && !isCancelled()) {
176                processedBy.updateNewEventsParent(generatedBy);
177                for (Event<?> e : completionEvents) {
178                    Channel[] completeChannels = e.channels();
179                    if (completeChannels.length == 0) {
180                        // Note that channels() cannot be empty, as it is set
181                        // when firing the event and an event is never fired
182                        // on no channels.
183                        completeChannels = channels();
184                        e.setChannels(completeChannels);
185                    }
186                    processedBy.add(e, completeChannels);
187                }
188            }
189            if (generatedBy != null) {
190                generatedBy.decrementOpen();
191            }
192            processedBy = null; // No longer needed
193        }
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Adds the given completion lock. 
198     * 
199     * @param lock the lock
200     * @see CompletionLock
201     */
202    /* default */ Event<T> addCompletionLock(CompletionLockBase lock) {
203        synchronized (this) {
204            if (completionLocks == null) {
205                completionLocks = Collections.synchronizedSet(new HashSet<>());
206            }
207        }
208        if (completionLocks.add(lock)) {
209            openCount.incrementAndGet();
210            lock.startTimer();
211        }
212        return (Event<T>) this;
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Removes the given completion lock. 
217     * 
218     * @param lock the lock
219     * @see CompletionLock
220     */
221    /* default */ void removeCompletionLock(CompletionLockBase lock) {
222        if (completionLocks == null) {
223            return;
224        }
225        if (completionLocks.remove(lock)) {
226            decrementOpen();
227        }
228        lock.cancelTimer();
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Disables tracking for this event and all events generated
233     * when handling it.
234     */
235    public Event<T> disableTracking() {
236        tracked = false;
237        return (Event<T>) this;
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Whether the event (and all events generated when handling it)
242     * is tracked.
243     * 
244     * @return `true` if event is tracked
245     */
246    public boolean isTracked() {
247        return tracked;
248    }
249
250    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UselessParentheses")
251    /* default */ boolean isTrackable() {
252        return generatedBy == null ? tracked
253            : (tracked && generatedBy.isTrackable());
254    }
255
256    /**
257     * Adds the given event to the events to be thrown when this event 
258     * has completed (see {@link #isDone()}). Such an event is called 
259     * a "completion event".
260     * 
261     * Completion events are considered to be caused by the event that 
262     * caused the completed event. If an event *e1* caused an event
263     * *e2* which has a completion event *e2c*, *e1* is only put in 
264     * state completed when *e2c* has been handled.
265     * 
266     * Completion events are handled by the same {@link EventProcessor}
267     * as the event that has been completed.
268     * 
269     * @param completionEvent the completion event to add
270     * @return the object for easy chaining
271     * @see #onCompletion(Event, Consumer)
272     */
273    public abstract Event<T> addCompletionEvent(Event<?> completionEvent);
274
275    /**
276     * Invokes the consumer when the event is completed. This is
277     * a shortcut for registering a {@link CompletionEvent} and
278     * providing a handler for the completion event that invokes 
279     * the consumer.
280     *
281     * @param <T> the result type of the event
282     * @param <E> the type of the event
283     * @param event the event
284     * @param consumer the consumer
285     */
286    public static <T, E extends Event<T>> void onCompletion(E event,
287            Consumer<E> consumer) {
288        event.addCompletionEvent(new ActionEvent<Event<T>>(
289            event.getClass().getSimpleName() + "CompletionAction") {
290            @Override
291            public void execute() throws Exception {
292                consumer.accept(event);
293            }
294        });
295    }
296}
